metadata.feature_description: Track and display article view counts

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki module at Community > Wiki
steps.expected: Wiki list page loads with articles
steps.actual: Wiki page loaded successfully showing 26 articles with search functionality and sorting options

steps.action: Click on 'User Mentions Feature Test' article to view it
steps.expected: Article page opens showing view count
steps.actual: Article page displayed with '3 Views' shown next to the date '1/9/2026' in the article info panel

steps.action: Return to Wiki list page and select 'Sort by views' from the dropdown
steps.expected: Articles should be reordered by view count (highest first)
steps.actual: Dropdown selection changed to 'Sort by views', URL updated to include 'sort=views' parameter, and articles reordered with 'XSS Sanitization Test Article' appearing first (most viewed)

steps.expected: Full list of articles sorted by view count
steps.actual: All 26 articles displayed sorted by views, with the sort dropdown showing 'Sort by views' selected

observations: Code review confirmed IncreaseViewCount method exists in ArticleController.cs (line 186-189) that increments view counts via the data provider
View count is displayed in both normal view (Article.ascx line 71-73) and mobile view (line 161-162) templates
Unique view tracking and view count for drafts would require more extensive testing beyond SMOKE level - no UI elements found to easily test these specific scenarios
The view count increment mechanism appears to be called automatically when viewing articles (server-side implementation)
